result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Jerome Skoug

CASES: 19CM199, 19CT52, 19CT65, 19CT84, 20CM34, 20CM204, 20CT20, 20CT95, 21CF473, 21CF483, 21CF501, 21CF502, 21CF503, 21CM3, 21CM63, 21CM88, 21CM146, 21CT11, 21CT51, 22CF31, 22CF45, 22CF63, 22CF83, 22CF157 & 22CF203.  2:30 PM Defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joshua Jerome Skoug. CW-clerk. 

19CT65-Count 2-Resisting-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

20CT20-Count 2-PAC 3rd-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

20CT95-Count 3-obstructing-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

21CM3-Count 3-misd retail theft-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

21CT11-Count 2-hit/run-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

21CM63-Count 1-obstructing-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

21CF473-Count 1-fel poss meth-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 3-misd obstructing-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

22CF31-Count 1-resisting/fail to stop, misd-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

22CF45-Count 1-fel poss meth PTAC-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

22CF83-Count 1-fel ID theft PTAC-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 3-fel bail jumping-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

22CF203-Count 2-fel uttering a forgery-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 3-misd fraud on financial institution-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 

All other files/counts DRI
3:23 pm recess.  3:34 pm back on the record. 

SENTENCING:
20CT20-Count 2-PAC 3rd-45 days PCJ, w/ Huber, subj to GT & WR, 24 mo rev w/ credit. 12 mo IID. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $1,544 fine. Bond to be applied. AODA. Zero credit. 

19CT65-Count 2-Resisting-DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $265.60 fine.  Bond to be applied.

20CT95-Count 3-obstructing-DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $243 costs only. Bond to be applied.

21CM3-Count 3-misd retail theft-w/h, probation 3 yrs. NC with Kwik Trip store in Osceola. 89 days credit. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, No fine. Restitution: $0.36 to Kwik Trip plus 10% & 5% surcharge.

21CT11-Count 2-hit/run-w/h, probation 3 yrs. NC with RLP & KSP. 89 days credit. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $300 fine plus costs, total $831. $250 to RLP & KSP with 10% surcharge & 5% surcharge. 

21CM63-Count 1-obstructing-DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $243 costs. Bond to be applied.

21CF473- 
Count 1-fel poss meth- w/h probation up to 5 yrs.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge, No fine. 9 mo CT-subj to WR, no GT consecutive to 20CT20. 89 days credit. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. No firearms. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Count 3-misd obstructing-DNA sample, $200 surcharge, No fine.

22CF31-Count 1-resisting/fail to stop, misd-w/h, probation 3 yrs. 89 days credit. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge. No fine.

22CF45-Count 1-fel poss meth PTAC- w/h probation up to 5 yrs. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. 89 days credit. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, No fine. No firearms. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.


22CF83-
Count 1-fel ID theft PTAC- w/h probation up to 5 yrs. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. 89 days credit.
DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $290.60 fine. No firearms. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  NC with SMB. $732.21 plus 10% plus 5% -Bremer bank.

Count 3-fel bail jumping- w/h probation up to 5 yrs. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. 89 days credit. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, no fine.  No firearms. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  

22CF203- 
*Count 2-fel uttering a forgery- w/h probation up to 5 yrs. NC with RAG & DG. Not to use or possess others identifying docs including checks. No AC with BRG. NC with Eliseo J Pantoja, Sarah Casey or known users/dealers.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge. No fine. No firearms. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  89 days credit. Extradition costs -$1216.95. Rest-$1074 to TDJ with 10% surcharge plus 5% surcharge. $400 to RAG plus 10% surcharge & 5% surcharge. 60 days CT, subj to WR, no GT, consecutive to 21CF473.


Count 3-misd fraud on financial institution-w/h, probation up to 3 yrs. NC with RAG & DG. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. 89 days credit. Follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, No fine. 

4:29 pm adj.

CASES: PH in 22CF157, ARGN in 22CF31, 22CF45, 22CF63 & 22CF83 and STC in 21CT51, 21CT11, 21CM146, 21CM88, 21CM63, 21CM03, 21CF503, 21CF502, 21CF501, 21CF483, 21CF473, 20CT95, 20CT20, 20CM204, 20CM34, 19CT84, 19CT65, 19CT52, 19CM199. Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joshua Jerome Skoug. 

PHA in 22CF157 - ADA Webster calls TRehban, S&T. Ct - identification made. Ct takes JN of signature bond in 21CF473 and cash bond in 21CF483, 21CF501, 21CF502, & 21CF503. Argument by Atty Chapman.  Argument by ADA Webster. Ct finds PC, de bound over. Atty Chapman - waive reading, plea NG to each count. 

ARGN in 22CF31, 22CF45, 22CF63 & 22CF83 - waive reading of each Information, plea NG to each count in each case.

Bond cont. JA to schedule. 2:19 p.m. adj.
Case Reassignment Order- Br 1 to Br 2

COVERS CASES: 22CF83, 22CF157, 22CF45 & 22CF63. Not to have contact with: S.M.B.  Not to possess or use any one else's personal documents. Absolute Sobriety.  No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

IA in 22CF157, PH in 22CF83, PH & AIA in 22CF63, AIA in 22CF45, PH in 22CF31 and STC in 21CT51, 21CT11, 21CM146, 21CM88, 21CM63, 21CM03, 21CF503, 21CF502, 21CF501, 21CF483, 21CF473, 20CT95, 20CT20, 20CM204, 20CM34, 19CT84, 19CT65, 19CT52, 19CM199 & 19TR894.  . Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joshua Jerome Skoug. 3:59 p.m. AO-Clerk. 

22CF157 Initial Appearance - De has rec'd CC, waive reading. Atty Chapman makes 4 corners challenge.  State responds. Ct denies four corners motion. Atty Chapman - NG plea entered on misd. charges.  State moves to extend existing bond to this case. Atty Chapman does not object. Ct - so ordered. DSPH. 

22CF31 Preliminary Hearing - ADA Webster calls Officer Gada, S&T. Ct takes JN of 9/27/21 signature bond in 21CF473, 21CT51 & 21CM146 and 10/15/21 cash bond in 21CF483, 21CF501, 21CF502, 21CF503. Ct - identification made, venue established, finds PC, de bound over. 

22CF45 Adjourned Initial Appearance - De has rec'd CC, waive reading, plea NG to misd. counts. State moves to extend existing bond to this case.  Atty Chapman does not object. Ct - so ordered for this case and all others that do not have bonds set. 
Preliminary Hearing - ADA Webster calls Officer Peters, S&T. Ct takes JN of bonds as previously requested in 22CF31. Ct - identification made, venue established, finds PC, de bound over. 

22CF63 Adjourned Initial Appearance - De has rec'd CC, waive reading, plea NG to misd. counts. Ct - existing bond extended to this file.
Preliminary Hearing - ADA Webster calls Office Rebhan, S&T.  Ct takes JN of bonds as previously requested in 22CF31. Ct - identification made, venue established, finds PC, de bound over. 

22CF83 Preliminary Hearing - ADA Webster calls VNeumann, S&T. Ct takes JN of bonds as previously requested in 22CF31. Ct - identification made, venue established, finds PC, de bound over. 

Bond cont. 4:36 p.m. adj.

CASES: RWIN in 22CF83 & RW in 19CM199, 19CT52, 19CT65, 19CT84, 20CM34, 20CM204, 20CT20, 20CT95, 21CF473, 21CF483, 21CF501, 21CF502, 21CF503, 21CM03, 21CM63, 21CM88, 21CM146, 21CT11, 21CT51, 22CF31, 22CF45 & 22CF63. Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug appeared by video means from the Polk County Jail. Attorney Dan Chapman appears by video means. 1:29 p.m. AO-Clerk. Atty Chapman - waive reading. State requests $25,000 cash bond. Ct sets bond. DSPH. Ct quashes warrants in all cases. 1:45 p.m. adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
22CF31, 21CF483, 21CF473, 21CF503, 22CF63, 22CF83, 22CF45:   Warrant Cancellation - In custody of Adams Co Jail - In custody Adams County Colorado.
(FAILED TO APPEAR- PRELIMINARY HEARING CODE ENTERED IN ERROR)

Defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug not in court.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug. 2:17 p.m. AO-Clerk. State request warrant. Ct issues nationwide warrant, body only. 2:17 p.m. adj.
